page.title: 11Penshaw Village
page.content: The village of Penshaw is the oldest village in this area and its rural origins can be found at{Old Penshaw. Here we can see the Church which dates back to 1746. Around the church are some of the oldest buildings including "Hill Farm House" and the large majestic stone built "Village Farm" house which now forms part of Penshaw Hill Riding School and Equestrian Centre. Along side these buildings we can also find two old village pubs and the remains of the {village green}as well as many modern detached bungalows and houses. Behind the church is a small terrace of stone built cottages, Lambton Place dated 1821. Around the corner can be seen{terraced housing}dated 1881 along side{post war development.}The most recent growth is in council & private housing built in the{60's and 70's.
